speaker: Nikita Puzankov
title: Kotlin Samara User Group
subject: Kotlin for Hackathons
description: Kotlin is a good language in many aspects. This talk will tell you about the main features that make it the right choice in case of fast development or prototyping. The real example of a hackathon project in Kotlin and comparison with equivalent parts of code in Java.

speaker: Nikita Fedyunin
title: Kotlin Samara User Group
subject: Kotlin. Is it broken or .. improved?
description: A story about how we fixed ugly api of android sdk (before google did it with KTX) and completely ruined an average library for integration tests.

speaker: Dan Rusu, Kyle Platt
title: Kotlin Waterloo P2P
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: This is an introduction to the Kotlin programming language. We'll include a brief look at some awesome features of this modern language as well as the many benefits. Kotlin is a free and open source programming language designed by JetBrains. It can be used for Android, JVM server back-end, javascript, as well as native development such as IOS. Come and enjoy some refreshments while we discuss Kotlin, objectives, and plans for this group.

speaker: Ilya Matveyev
title: JUGNsk
subject: Kotlin вообще и Native в частности
description: Наверняка многие слышали о таком языке для JVM, как Котлин. Однако далеко не все знают, что он также компилируется в JavaScript или в нативный код для различных платформ. В этом докладе мы постараемся пролить свет на поддержку мультиплатформенных проектов, а также расскажем о том, как мы компилируем Котлин в машинный код, какие сложности при этом встречаются и какие возможности дает это пользователю.

speaker: Janibek Marshal
title: JDrinkUp Almaty
subject: Почему Android разработчики переходят на Kotlin

speaker: Piotr Ślesarew
title: MobiConf 2018
subject: Magic sugars that can make your Kotlin codebase happier
description:
Kotlin language brings tons of new concepts and features to your miserable programming life and it is really hard to use all of them in your daily duties. After almost two years of using Kotlin in production, the language itself can give me joy and satisfaction.

How is it possible? Because of its many small sweet sugars 🍰. In this talk, I would like to share with you my favorite Kotlin candies that I discovered when I was in need of writing robust and concise components for Android applications.

speaker: Ivan Morgillo
title: MobiConf 2018
subject:
Kotlin coroutines – A story of an old code base, dozens of reactive streams, a new language and a new
            way for concurrency.
description:
In a world dominated by RX and Java based code bases, JetBrains introduced Kotlin and coroutines - a simpler way to do multithreading.

This is the story of how I migrated an old project from a monolithic Java mess with improperly used RxJava to a cleaner architecture, based on Kotlin, coroutines and common sense.

speaker: Toshihiro Yagi
title: Kotlin Fest 2018
subject: Kotlin コルーチンを 理解しよう

speaker: Anton Arhipov
title: Advanced Java Estonia
subject: Kotlin DSL in 60 minutes
description: Learn how to create type-safe and statically typed DSLs in Kotlin. The session starts with an introduction to DSL related Kotlin language features. Next, we create a simple DSL in a live coding session and then continue adding expressiveness and language features. We cover a number of examples, like JSON or XML builder's, data binding, configuration & template engines

speaker: Ohad Shai
title: KotlinTLV
subject: Klean that Code, Boil those Boilerplates

speaker: Yair Palti
title: KotlinTLV
subject: Static & Singleton in Java vs Kotlin

speaker: Marharyta Nedzelska
title: Voxxed Days Ticino 2018
subject: Kotlin: lazy language for lazy people
description: A few years ago you had to work hard to succeed in some fields. Nowadays you don’t need to work hard but to work smart. So this means that most of the time laziness (of course not extremely) is useful for our productivity. On the other hand, laziness is extremely important when you work with a large amount of data and reduced space or power. In this talk we will try to cover all aspects of laziness in Kotlin: starting from lazy initialization of properties using delegates, lazy collections, sequences and, finally, laziness with coroutines. The main thing we would like to talk about is how to use this laziness and be productive with it. To see one more benefit of laziness in Kotlin we’ll refactor a real application to use lazy calculations.

speaker: Paulien van Alst
title: Utrecht Java User Group
subject: How to build a Kotlin enterprise application.
description: Kotlin is the new JVM language where all the best practices of programming come together. Looking forward to discover a language that will support you in writing readable and understandable code in the fewest lines possible? Without any help of any extra libraries such as Lombok, Guava and even more, Kotlin will challenge you to write code that even the business analyst should be able to understand. With Kotlin you can finally focus on the business features you want to implement instead working on the language itself. In this workshop, you will build a simple webservice in Kotlin and hopefully see how easy it can be to write new business functionality. - Exercise 1 : (data) classes, collections and types - Exercise 2 : inheritance, interfaces and extension functions - Exercise 3 : how to integrate Kotlin with Spring

speaker: Tomás Hanley
title: Dublin Kotlin User Group
subject: Asynchronous Kotlin Web Server with Ktor
description: In this session, we’re going to explore how to create a standalone server application using Ktor. We'll work through a series of exercises to get familiar with Ktor, with the idea of build a web service for ordering food for our drone delivery app.

speaker: Lukas Lechner
title: droidcon Vienna 2018
subject: How 'Effective Java' influenced Kotlin
description: One of the most popular Java books is 'Effective Java' from Joshua Bloch, which describes how to avoid common mistakes, how to deal with Java's weaknesses, and how best practices for the language look like. When Jetbrains started to create a 'better Java' with Kotlin, a lot of ideas about how to make a better language came from the information of 'Effective Java' and lots of design decisions are based on the book. In this talk the audience will learn how the book influenced the language design and the compiler of Kotlin and in what way the book is deeply ingrained into the language.

speaker: Marcin Moskala
title: Mobile Optimazed 2018
subject: Kotlin Coroutines in action
description:
Kotlin Coroutines fascinate from its early beta. They are a new way to write asynchronous and non-blocking code. They can be thought of as light-weight threads without having to deal with all the problems that threads bring to the table.

In this talk Marcin will show how to use Kotlin Coroutines and what makes them so special and so efficient. He will also discuss if they are an alternative to RxJava.

speaker: Sergey Kryukov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Введение в OPENRNDR
description: Продолжаю тему “нецелевого” использования языка Kotlin. В этот раз поговорим об OPENRNDR — фреймворке для креативного программирования, как убеждают его авторы. Так ли это? Проверим на практике.

speaker: Roman Artemiev
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin/JS
description: В докладе речь пойдет про Kotlin/JS, я расскажу что это такое и зачем нужно в контексте Kotlin MPP (Multiplatform Projects). Покопаемся под капотом у компилятора, познакомимся с полезными инструментами для разработки на Kotlin/JS. Немного затронем будущее этого направления языка, а также постараемся ответить на самые волнующие сообщество вопросы. Приходите, будет интересно!

speaker: Sergio Dos Santos, Benjamin Lacroix
title: Le Mois Du Kotlin
subject: Kotlin ? D’accord, mais aide moi à convaincre mon PO !
description: Kotlin fait petit à petit son chemin dans les entreprises, et pas seulement sur Android ! Quels sont les avantages du langage par rapport à Java, par rapport aux autres langages back-end et même par rapport à Javascript ? D'où vient Kotlin ? Faut-il migrer les applications et former les équipiers ? Peut-on réaliser des applications de qualité, qui dureront dans le temps ? Quels sont les outils à notre disposition ? Si vous vous posez toutes ces questions, ou si vous souhaitez seulement en savoir plus sur ce prochain langage d'importance, venez, cette conférence est faite pour vous !

speaker: Simone Civetta
title: Le Mois Du Kotlin
subject: Frameworks multi-plateformes partagés avec Kotlin / Native
description: Bien que la création d'applications inter-plates-formes complètes puisse souvent s'avérer être une mauvaise idée, une logique spécifique à un client peut grandement bénéficier d'un code unique, permettant à la fois d'écrire et de tester le code. Depuis fin 2016, Kotlin/Native peut compiler du code Kotlin sous une forme binaire, qui peut ensuite être intégrée dans une application native. Dans cette présentation, vous apprendrez pourquoi il est logique et efficace d'exploiter ces fonctionnalités expérimentales et de créer un module multi-plateforme réutilisable sur Android et iOS.

speaker: Shady Yehia Selim
title: GDG Helwan
subject: Kotlin Surprises in Google I/O 2018!
description: Collecting all the Kotlin announcements in Google I/O 2018

speaker: Didier Plaindoux
title: Sunny Tech 2018
subject: Kotlin Parsec
description: Un Parsec est bien connu pour mesurer la distance à laquelle se trouve une étoile dont la parallaxe est d'une seconde . Cela vous semble cryptique je vous propose alors plutôt de traiter de Parser Combinator avec Kotlin afin de découvrir certaines facettes du langage comme l'extension de fonction et la construction d'un DSL dédié.

speaker: Víctor Bolinches
title: Kotlin MasterClass
subject: Desarrollo Multiplataforma con Kotlin
description:
Kotlin es un lenguaje fuertemente tipado, cross-platform y open source, bajo la licencia Apache 2.0, creado por JetBrains. Su programación es concisa, versátil y segura. Interoperable con Java al 100%, es el lenguaje oficial de Google para aplicaciones Android nativas. Permite desarrollos nativos en sistemas embebidos tales como Windows, Linux, Mac e iOS, así como una fácil programación a través de DSL’s en el marco Web.

Los asistentes a las charla podrán recibir una MasterClass de Kotlin para abordar desarrollos multiplataforma.

Se migrará código de Java a Kotlin para comprender su sintaxis, apoyado con ejemplos de uso.

speaker: Akinrolie Slick
title: KOTLIN NIGHT ABUJA '18
subject: Best practices in using Kotlin on Android
description: taking the participants through the best possible ways and steps to build Android Apps with Kotlin

title: KOTLIN NIGHT ABUJA '18
subject: Kotlin In Action with Codelab session

title: KOTLIN NIGHT ABUJA '18
subject: Kotlin Lang What's in Need with Codelab Session: Api with Kotlin

speaker: Antonis Lilis
title: Voxxed Athens 2018
subject: Why Kotlin?
description:
Do you like Java but wish you didn’t have to write so much boilerplate code? Maybe it’s time for a switch. Kotlin aims to address many of the pitfalls that are common with Java development, while making your code more concise, safe, and expressive. It is also 100% interoperable with Java and can be easily mixed in the same project.

In this presentation Antonis will try to guide you through the main features of Kotlin that make it so special and provide a short introduction to the language.

description: Introduce using kotlin for android developer

speaker: Nick Capurso
title: 360|AnDev July 2018
subject: Kotlin Coroutines: An Intro to Practical Use on Android
description:
Asynchronous programming has always been a challenging problem for Android developers. Any good solution has to gracefully handle errors, cancellation, chaining multiple actions together, handle thread swapping, and much more.

Kotlin’s coroutines are yet another option for asynchronous programming. However, unlike other popular contenders, coroutines meet all the previously mentioned requirements out-of-the-box, have a gentler learning curve, and don’t require you to write an absurd amount of boilerplate.

That said, learning any new asynchronous solution takes time and often comes with a period of trial-and-error until you have all the nuances figured out. Get a jumpstart on coroutines:

(1) Lessen the learning curve by getting the subtleties of coroutines out of the way early (2) Learn how to work coroutines into an existing app: easy places to start transitioning, interop with existing libraries, and reusing existing threading constructs (3) Learn how to easily support error handling, cancellation, and task chaining (4) Learn how to unit test coroutines

Get a head start on coroutines in your apps and easily write, test, and maintain asynchronous code like never before!

speaker: Oluwasegun Famisa
title: 360|AnDev July 2018
subject: Kotlin, Beyond the Basics
description:
In this talk, we will look at how you should not do things with Kotlin. For example, we will talk about misusing scoping functions like “let”, “run”, “apply”, etc. and learn the right time to use which one while not overusing them. We will also talk about interoperability between Kotlin and Java. We will look at how not to do things when building APIs that may be consumed in Java – things like top-level constant declaration vs constants within companion objects, making use Jvm* annotations in Kotlin vs not using them.

We will also talk about platform types and the potential harm they pose when calling Java code from Kotlin. We will also address another commonly overlooked topic – the fact that Kotlin encourages a new paradigm of programming where you’re not thinking in terms of steps (imperative) but rather, in terms of functions applied to parameters (functional programming) and we still find ourselves doing things the wrong way.

speaker: Joshua Lamson
title: 360|AnDev July 2018
subject: Custom Drawing with Canvas in Kotlin
description:
When you’re creating a new View to display some complex data, it’s easy for the number of View objects you’re using to get out of control. Between elaborate shapes, shaders/colors, and text in specific places and orientations, using only Android Views and layouts can turn your layout into a dense, complicated mess. Luckily, there’s a better way to add all your customizations. What you need is a blank Canvas! (Literally, android.graphics.Canvas).

In this session, we’ll delve into the details of using a Canvas to display anything you need in a truly custom way, explaining it all through simple examples written in Kotlin. You’ll leave this talk knowing how override the behavior of View, ViewGroup, and Drawable to draw custom shapes, paths, and text on the Canvas.

speaker: Sergey Sitko
title: GDG Minsk
subject: Разбираемся с Kotlin coroutines
description: Общий подход асинхронного программирования. Короткое ревью возможностей Java concurrent API, RxJava, Android API. Знакомство с Kotlin Coroutine. Что такое coroutine, как это чудо создавать и как им пользоваться.

speaker: Brian
title: GDG Kampala
subject: Android Things and Kotlin
description: In this talk, Brian tells us about the latest and greatest about Kotlin released at Google I/O 2018 and about the development of Sentinel, the first home security robot powered by Android Things, and how hardware, software, coded in Kotlin, Firebase and how the Google Cloud Platform integrates with Sentinel to "bring it to life".

speaker: Johnstone
title: GDG Kampala
subject: Kotlin Multiplatform Projects
description: A Kotlin multiplatform project allows you share code between different platforms. It takes a different approach to cross platform development than Xamarin and other frameworks. This talk will be about how to setup and build a multiplatform project. We will look at features of Kotlin multiplatform development through an example project. We will also look at the current limitations.

En este meetup crearemos un microservicio con kotlin, usando frameworks de la industria, con clean architecture y lo desplegaremos en Google Cloud Platform.

description: Bu etkinliğimizde Hadi Tok bizlere varolan android uygulamalarımızda kullandığımız Java dilinin kotlin ile beraber kullanımı, Java kodlarının Kotlin'e dönüştürülmesi ve bu geçişte karşılaşılan genel problemler ve bu problemlerin çözüm yollarından bahsedecek.

speaker: Urs Peter
title: Utrecht Kotlin Meetup
subject: From Java to Kotlin in 60 minutes
description: In de eerste sessie zal Urs Peter via live-coding laten zien hoe makkelijk het is om van Java naar Kotlin over te stappen en welke voordelen daarbij komen kijken. Hij maakt gebruik van Java code snippets, die stapsgewijs worden omgezet naar Kotlin terwijl de belangrijkste taal features toegelicht worden. Tot slot licht hij toe hoe je Kotlin succesvol in je organisatie kunt introduceren op basis van de ervaringen die hij heeft opgedaan bij Coin.

speaker: Alexey Soshin
title: GOTO Nights Amsterdam
subject: Concurrency with VertX in Kotlin
description: In this talk we'll discuss how to write highly concurrent web scrapper on top of Vert.x and Kotlin. Let's assume you want to have the entire LOLcatz archive on your laptop. That's thousands of pages you need to parse, to get those funny picture URL's from, then actually download them. I plan to demonstrate how the asynchronous model of Vert.x can help us with this very important tasks and get the maximum from your hardware. Also in this talk, some more serious stuff: pipelines, worker verticles, the EventBus and asynchronous work with the file system.

speaker: Branimir Akmadža
title: Infinum Android Talks / Zagreb
subject: UI Tests and Kotlin Robots
description: When I first started to implement UI tests in my project, I thought to myself "What a huge amount of code for something so simple - I only need to check if my image is really shown". After some time spent on research, I discovered a very nice pattern that is possible to set up in Kotlin - DSL robots. In this talk I will show you how that Kotlin sorcery looks like, and why you should (or should not) implement UI tests!

speaker: Leonardo Pirro
title: GDG Torino
subject: Better Async With Kotlin Coroutines
description: In questo talk scopriremo i principi base delle coroutines e quanto è semplice implementarle nei nostri progetti.

title: GDG Torino

description: Impareremo a scrivere codice asincrono con RxJava e le altre librerie ReactiveX

description: Durante l’evento saranno presenti tanti gadget per i partecipanti e il servizio di catering gentilmente offerto da Synesthesia.

description: We'll have a tech talk then a workshop where you will learn the basics of Kotlin, create an Android app using it, and you will see why you should make the switch from Java to Kotlin.

At SANDEC Weekly Training # 53 this time, we will learn about the (new) language used in creating Android app, which is KOTLIN. a new multi-purpose programming language developed by JetBrains.

In this workshop, my friends will know what the difference when we use Kotlin in making an application in android. This workshop will be filled by Mas Kalif Ardi N - One of the trainers at SANDEC.

description: In this talk you’ll learn how to you to build and deploy a Kotlin react frontend application using webpack and kotlin-frontend-plugin. We’ll write a simple backend via Ktor and deploy it all on one of the cloud service providers.

The best way to handle bad data is to create a strict schema before capturing it. In this talk, you will learn how to improve the quality of data flowing from legacy sources with Kotlin and Baleen, an open source library.

description:
When you’re creating a new View to display some complex data, it’s easy for the number of View objects you’re using to get out of control. Between elaborate shapes, shaders/colors, and text in specific places and orientations, using only Android Views and layouts can turn your layout into a dense, complicated mess. Luckily, there’s a better way to add all your customizations. What you need is a blank Canvas! (Literally, android.graphics.Canvas).

In this session, we’ll delve into the details of using a Canvas to display anything you need in a truly custom way, explaining it all through simple examples written in Kotlin. You’ll leave this talk knowing how override the behavior of View, ViewGroup, and Drawable to draw custom shapes, paths, and text on the Canvas.

description: I want to tell you about one of the modern and trending languages of today - Kotlin, which among other cool features, has JS compilation target. So if it is possible to use Kotlin today - definitely yes! And I'll show you why =)

speaker: Christophe Beyls
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Kotlin's hidden costs, revisited
description: Kotlin has become the new default modern programming language for many Android and backend developers. But exactly how much performance and code size are we sacrificing for making use of all the additional features this language provides compared to Java? We'll study the Java bytecode generated by the Kotlin compiler in various scenarios in order to find out which code constructs come with hidden performance penalties and learn how to become better Kotlin programmers. Some significant improvements in the recent versions of Kotlin will also be highlighted. This talk is based on the series of blog posts from the speaker and extends it in some areas.

speaker: Niklas Baudy
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Kotlin on Code Quality Tools
description: Some might have heard about code quality tools such as Checkstyle, PMD, Findbugs, Lint, Detekt and others but which ones are applicable to Kotlin? I'll list a bunch of tools, explain what they can do, touch on how they work and most importantly show you how you can start using them to be more productive and save a lot of time. With the help of these analyzers you can focus on coding conventions in your team, catch a few bugs and concentrate on what really matters when reviewing code

speaker: Anton Spaans
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Weaponize your Functional Kotlin with an Arro
description: This talk is an introduction of how you can apply basic functional data types into your Kotlin applications. We will introduce concepts of functional programming and the basic functional data types provided by the Arrow library and show examples on how to use it all in your applications

speaker: Patrick Beagan
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Let, Also, With, Apply, Run
description: If you've ever seen kotlin code with words like "let, also, with, apply, run" thrown in and wondered what they're for, we'll cover them in this talk. We'll go over the basic usages of each of these standard library functions, the patterns that they can supplement, and how to extend their functionality to help consolidate your code!

I dag skal vi høre Thomas Pettersen snakke om hvor mye Kotlin forenkler livet vårt når det gjelder utvikling for Android. Det blir lett servering med pizza og brus, og muligheter til mingling og diskusjoner etter foredraget.
